zerotier_central_token.description: ZeroTier Central API Token; you can generate a new one at https://my.zerotier.com/account.

zerotier_central_url.description: ZeroTier Central API endpoint. Unlikely you'll need to alter this unless you're testing ZeroTier central itself.

private_key.description: The private key of the identity.

public_key.description: The public key of the identity.

block.description: Identity generator for ZeroTier members. Use this provider with others to authenticate and join users to your networks.

allow_ethernet_bridging.description: Is this member allowed to activate ethernet bridging over the ZeroTier network?

authorized.description: Is the member authorized on the network?

network_id.description: ID of the network this member belongs to

no_auto_assign_ips.description: Exempt this member from the IP auto assignment pool on a Network

block.description: Manage ZeroTier members and join them to networks

creation_time.description: The time at which this network was created, in epoch seconds

enable_broadcast.description: Enable broadcast packets on the network

flow_rules.description: The layer 2 flow rules to apply to packets traveling across this network. Please see https://www.zerotier.com/manual/#3_4_1 for more information.

id.description: ZeroTier's internal network identifier, aka NetworkID

multicast_limit.description: Maximum number of recipients per multicast or broadcast. Warning - Setting this to 0 will disable IPv4 communication on your network!

private.description: Whether or not the network is private.  If false, members will *NOT* need to be authorized to join.

end.description: The last address in the assignment rule. This must be the highest number in the pool. end must also be accompanied by start.

start.description: The first address in the assignment rule. This must be the lowest number in the pool. `start` must also be accompanied by `end`.

block.description: Network provider for ZeroTier, allows you to create ZeroTier networks.

name.description: The name of the token; if you do not supply this value, one will be generated

creation_time.description: The time at which this network was created, in epoch seconds

enable_broadcast.description: Enable broadcast packets on the network

flow_rules.description: The layer 2 flow rules to apply to packets traveling across this network. Please see https://www.zerotier.com/manual/#3_4_1 for more information.

id.description: ZeroTier's internal network identifier, aka NetworkID

multicast_limit.description: Maximum number of recipients per multicast or broadcast. Warning - Setting this to 0 will disable IPv4 communication on your network!

private.description: Whether or not the network is private.  If false, members will *NOT* need to be authorized to join.

end.description: The last address in the assignment rule. This must be the highest number in the pool. end must also be accompanied by start.

start.description: The first address in the assignment rule. This must be the lowest number in the pool. `start` must also be accompanied by `end`.

block.description: Data source for ZeroTier networks, allowing you to find a network by ID
